Method Detail

clone

public ParticleEmitter clone()
Description copied from class: Geometry
This version of clone is a shallow clone, in other words, the same mesh is referenced as the original geometry. Exception: if the mesh is marked as being a software animated mesh, (bind pose is set) then the positions and normals are deep copied.

Overrides:
clone in class Geometry
Returns:
A clone of this Spatial, the scene graph in its entirety is cloned and can be altered independently of the original scene graph. Note that meshes of geometries are not cloned explicitly, they are shared if static, or specially cloned if animated. All controls will be cloned using the Control.cloneForSpatial method on the clone.
See Also:
Mesh.cloneForAnim()

cloneForSpatial

public Control cloneForSpatial(Spatial spatial)
Description copied from interface: Control
Creates a clone of the Control, the given Spatial is the cloned version of the spatial to which this control is attached to.

Specified by:

getNumVisibleParticles

public int getNumVisibleParticles()

setNumParticles

public final void setNumParticles(int numParticles)
Parameters:
numParticles - The maximum amount of particles that can exist at the same time with this emitter. Calling this method many times is not recommended.

getParticles

public Particle[] getParticles()
Returns:
A list of all particles (shouldn't be used in most cases). This includes both existing and non-existing particles. The size of the array is set to the numParticles value specified in the constructor or setNumParticles(int) method.

getFaceNormal

public Vector3f getFaceNormal()

setFaceNormal

public void setFaceNormal(Vector3f faceNormal)
Sets the normal which particles are facing. By default, particles will face the camera, but for some effects (e.g shockwave) it may be necessary to face a specific direction instead. To restore normal functionality, provide null as the argument for faceNormal.

Parameters:
faceNormal - The normals particles should face, or null if particles should face the camera.

getRotateSpeed

public float getRotateSpeed()

setRotateSpeed

public void setRotateSpeed(float rotateSpeed)
Parameters:
rotateSpeed - Set the rotation speed in radians/sec for particles spawned after the invocation of this method.

isRandomAngle

public boolean isRandomAngle()

setRandomAngle

public void setRandomAngle(boolean randomAngle)
Parameters:
randomAngle - Set to true if every particle spawned should have a random facing angle.

isSelectRandomImage

public boolean isSelectRandomImage()

setSelectRandomImage

public void setSelectRandomImage(boolean selectRandomImage)
Parameters:
selectRandomImage - Set to true if every particle spawned should get a random image from a pool of images constructed from the texture, with X by Y possible images. By default, X and Y are equal to 1, thus allowing only 1 possible image to be selected, but if the particle is configured with multiple images by using setImagesX(int) and {#link ParticleEmitter#setImagesY(int) } methods, then multiple images can be selected. Setting to false will cause each particle to have an animation of images displayed, starting at image 1, and going until image X*Y when the particle reaches its end of life.

isFacingVelocity

public boolean isFacingVelocity()

setFacingVelocity

public void setFacingVelocity(boolean followVelocity)
Parameters:
followVelocity - Set to true if particles spawned should face their velocity (or direction to which they are moving towards). This is typically used for e.g spark effects.

getEndColor

public ColorRGBA getEndColor()

setEndColor

public void setEndColor(ColorRGBA endColor)
Parameters:
endColor - Set the end color of the particles spawned. The particle color at any time is determined by blending the start color and end color based on the particle's current time of life relative to its end of life.

getEndSize

public float getEndSize()

setEndSize

public void setEndSize(float endSize)
Parameters:
endSize - Set the end size of the particles spawned.The particle size at any time is determined by blending the start size and end size based on the particle's current time of life relative to its end of life.

getGravity

public float getGravity()

setGravity

public void setGravity(float gravity)
Parameters:
gravity - Set the gravity, in units/sec/sec, of particles spawned.

getHighLife

public float getHighLife()

setHighLife

public void setHighLife(float highLife)
Parameters:
highLife - Set the high value of life. The particle's lifetime/expiration is determined by randomly selecting a time between low life and high life.

getImagesX

public int getImagesX()

setImagesX

public void setImagesX(int imagesX)
Parameters:
imagesX - Set the number of images along the X axis (width). To determine how multiple particle images are selected and used, see the setSelectRandomImage(boolean) method.

getImagesY

public int getImagesY()

setImagesY

public void setImagesY(int imagesY)
Parameters:
imagesY - Set the number of images along the Y axis (height). To determine how multiple particle images are selected and used, see the setSelectRandomImage(boolean) method.

getLowLife

public float getLowLife()

setLowLife

public void setLowLife(float lowLife)
Parameters:
lowLife - Set the low value of life. The particle's lifetime/expiration is determined by randomly selecting a time between low life and high life.

getParticlesPerSec

public float getParticlesPerSec()

setParticlesPerSec

public void setParticlesPerSec(float particlesPerSec)
Parameters:
particlesPerSec - Set the number of particles to spawn per second.

getStartColor

public ColorRGBA getStartColor()

setStartColor

public void setStartColor(ColorRGBA startColor)
Parameters:
startColor - Set the start color of the particles spawned. The particle color at any time is determined by blending the start color and end color based on the particle's current time of life relative to its end of life.

getStartSize

public float getStartSize()

setStartSize

public void setStartSize(float startSize)
Parameters:
startSize - Set the start size of the particles spawned.The particle size at any time is determined by blending the start size and end size based on the particle's current time of life relative to its end of life.

getInitialVelocity

public Vector3f getInitialVelocity()

setInitialVelocity

public void setInitialVelocity(Vector3f initialVelocity)
Parameters:
initialVelocity - Set the initial velocity a particle is spawned with, the initial velocity given in the parameter will be varied according to the velocity variation set in setVelocityVariation(float). A particle will move toward its velocity unless it is effected by the gravity.
See Also:
setVelocityVariation(float), setGravity(float)

getVelocityVariation

public float getVelocityVariation()

setVelocityVariation

public void setVelocityVariation(float variation)
Parameters:
variation - Set the variation by which the initial velocity of the particle is determined. variation should be a value from 0 to 1, where 0 means particles are to spawn with exactly the velocity given in ParticleEmitter#setStartVel(com.jme3.math.Vector3f) , and 1 means particles are to spawn with a completely random velocity.

emitAllParticles

public void emitAllParticles()
Instantly emits all the particles possible to be emitted. Any particles which are currently inactive will be spawned immediately.

killAllParticles

public void killAllParticles()
Instantly kills all active particles, after this method is called, all particles will be dead and no longer visible.

setSpatial

public void setSpatial(Spatial spatial)
Do not use.

Specified by:
setSpatial in interface Control
Parameters:
spatial - the spatial to be controlled. This should not be called from user code.

setEnabled

Specified by:
setEnabled in interface Control
Parameters:
enabled - Set to enable or disable a particle. When a particle is disabled, it will be "frozen in time" and not update.

Specified by:

True if enabled, false otherwise.
